intro: Pedicularis smithiana, commonly known as the Smith's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
